title: Drawing, "Concept Drawing for Blair House, Residence of William McCormick Blair, Lake Forest, Illinois", ca. 1917
medium: Graphite and colored pastel on tracing paper mounted on white wove paper (letterhead)
inscribed: Verso in graphite, notes from the donor Henry Miliken: This is a rough 1st sketch by David Adler / of Chicago who used to be my partner. It is / an early idea for a house he later built / for one of the Blairs Wm. [?] near Lake /  Forest, Ill. / I personally think Adler the best residential / architect in the middle west and one of the best / in the whole country. He has done some of the largest / residences in the country.  Aside from Chicago such / things as the R.T.Crane house, Ipswich, Mass. Newhall / Field's residence on 70th St. and lately Wm [?] E.M. Fields / house on Long Island. / Sketches of his are rare.  If you wrangle out of him / the rendering he did for the N.Y. house of the Fields you / would be lucky but do not mention this sketch as he / no longer speaks to me and might resent it.
dimensions: Sheet: 6.3 x 17.9 cm (2 1/2 x 7 1/16 in.), irregular; mount: 7.8 x 18.2 cm (3 1/16 x 7 3/16 in.)
description: Elevation of two storied house, with portico, terminating in gable roofed wings set at right angles. Suggestion of figures and trees.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Concept Drawing for Blair House, Residence of William McCormick Blair, Lake Forest, Illinois", ca. 1917.
ca. 1917. Graphite and colored pastel on tracing paper mounted on white wove paper (letterhead). Gift of Henry O. Milliken. 1937-51-3.
